title: Human-Autonomy Team Interaction and Failure Response Simulation Training

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Team Dynamics and Technical Systems, with Secondary Education Experience
context.additional_context: Practice-centered training for pre-service/in-service teachers to enhance Human-Autonomy Teaming (HAT) interaction and crisis response competencies

learning_goals: They can analyze communication patterns and coordination mechanisms of 3-member teams in simulation environments to explain the evolution of HAT (Human-Autonomy Teaming)
They can design and execute team adaptation strategies for three failure scenarios: automation failure, autonomy errors, and cyberattacks
They can evaluate team communication flow using cross-recurrence quantification analysis (JRQA) and propose performance improvement measures
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
